World Nuclear Newshttps://www.world-nuclear-news.org/?rss=feedWorld Nuclear News recent storiesen-GB 5b1731bc-7434-411e-a318-7620c280a9c6 Poland's Pomerania backs proposed nuclear plant locationThe decision by the regional authorities to determine the territorial scope - on both land and sea - of Poland's first nuclear power plant in the Lubiatowo-Kopalino site in the Choczewo municipality in Pomerania意味着 Polskie Elektrownie Jądrowe 已获得使用该区域进行筹备工作的权利。; Fri, 27 Oct 2023 09:47:37 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Poland-s-Pomerania-backs-proposed-nuclear-plant-lo?feed=feed 849e3370-d6b3-4a84-97e6-0c881ca6f961 Satu Katajala becomes WANO regional centre directorThe World Association of Nuclear Operators has appointed Satu Katajala as its next Paris Centre Director in what it describes as a "significant milestone in support of diversity in the nuclear industry". Fri, 27 Oct 2023 15:02:27 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Satu-Katajala-becomes WANO-regional-centre-directo?feed=feed 55ff6cff-0284-4a2c-977a-655c3ace70dfRepair work under way at Krško nuclear power plantThe Krško nuclear power plant was shut down in early October after the discovery of a leak in the primary circuit connection system pipeline. Operator Nuklearna elektrarna Krško says that following further investigation and analysis, a decision has been taken to replace the complete pipeline segment from the reactor vessel to the first valve. Fri, 27 Oct 2023 13:52:00 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Repair-work-under-way-at-Krsko-nuclear-power-plant?feed=feed 72cfa679-2537-419c-a1a0-7d8bd3cce60dEPRI, NEA in WISARD waste integration collaborationThe upcoming Joint Project on Waste Integration for Small and Advanced Reactor Designs - or WISARD - will focus on exploring how front-end and design phase decisions impact back-end strategies to support sustainable future nuclear systems. Fri, 27 Oct 2023 14:19:34 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/EPRI,-NEA-in-WISARD-waste-integration-collaboratio?feed=feed 4f7f8bf9-35df-428c-98cc-73da1f38a62f CNSC renews licences for Cameco uranium operationsThe renewed licences authorise the company to continue to operate the Key Lake, McArthur River and Rabbit Lake sites. Rabbit Lake's renewed licence is valid until October 2038, and those for Key Lake and McArthur River until October 2043. Thu, 26 Oct 2023 14:33:03 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/CNSC-renews-licences-for-Cameco-uranium-operations?feed=feed 42682e89-5ce5-4944-a128-869d428c7a78 Atucha 1 extension: Environmental impact study submittedNucleoeléctrica Argentina has delivered the environmental impact study for the Atucha I extension project which aims to add a further 20 years to the unit's operating life. Thu, 26 Oct 2023 12:58:15 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Atucha-1-extension-Environmental-impact-study-subm?feed=feed 650e0373-8463-4d0f-a2de-c05ba1149945 Transportable microreactor project gets US DOE supportX-Energy Reactor Company, LLC and the US Department of Energy have signed a cooperative agreement through 2024 to further advance the development of a transportable mobile microreactor design.
; Thu, 26 Oct 2023 12:17:32 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Transportable-microreactor-project-gets-US-DOE-sup?feed=feed 17755e43-e9f1-4007-巴德-5dd695a38995 IAEA warning after explosions heard near KhmelnitskyInternational Atomic Energy Agency Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi warns that nearby explosions which shattered windows at Ukraine's Khmelnitsky nuclear power plant "show just how close it was - and underlines the extremely precarious nuclear safety situation ... which will continue as long as this tragic war goes on". Thu, 26 Oct 2023 12:11:10 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/IAEA-warning-after-explosions-heard-near-Khmelnits?feed=feed cd62fa55-0833-41c4-8a36-adae57d2ae30Low-level waste recycling facility opens in OntarioLaurentis Energy Partners - a subsidiary of Ontario Power Generation - has opened a new facility in Kincardine, Ontario, for the sorting and recycling of low-level radioactive waste. It says the facility will minimise waste associated with nuclear energy generation. Wed, 25 Oct 2023 15:05:50 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Low-level-waste-recycling-facility-opens-in-Ontari?feed=feed 3fd90036-938c-425e-b02e-99bd6fb3eae9 Bulgaria to push ahead with two new units at KozloduyThe Council of Ministers in Bulgaria has given the go-head for the construction of the new unit 7 and preparatory work for unit 8 at the Kozloduy nuclear power plant, with both to feature AP1000 reactors. Wed, 25 Oct 2023 13:37:01 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Bulgaria-to-push-ahead-with-two-new-units-at-Kozlo?feed=feed 193157bf-ab70-4ae8-b48a-90dfe16b624d eVinci 'accelerator hub' planned for PittsburghWestinghouse Electric Company has launched a new design and manufacturing facility in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, to accelerate commercialisation of its eVinci microreactor. Wed, 25 Oct 2023 11:47:03 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/eVinci-accelerator-hub-planned-for-Pittsburgh?feed=feed
